titles.title: Tuition Tax Credit Act of 1997
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a Federal income tax credit for tuition.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Tuition Tax Credit Act of 1997 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a nonrefundable individual income tax credit for the educational expenses (tuition and supplies) of the taxpayer, spouse, or dependents at an eligible private elementary or secondary school, institution of higher education, or vocational school. Limits the credit to $1,000 per student per year.
